message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.MM

This paper deals with computer vision and machine learning techniques for 3D human pose estimation from monocular RGB images. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a novel approach for estimating metric-scale poses without relying on anthropometric heuristics or test-time knowledge of the focal length or person distance. This involves training a fully-convolutional network to estimate metric-scale truncation-robust volumetric heatmaps. Hence, the paper also falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The proposed method involves reasoning about joints beyond the image boundary, which requires a certain level of robotics knowledge, making cs.RO (Robotics) another likely category. The paper also involves the use of deep learning techniques for pose estimation, which falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on benchmark datasets, which involves computer vision and multimedia techniques, making cs.MM (Multimedia) another possible category.
